OOC: I will let airly repsond first, as the black tower is her base and she=
 may have unseen things in place. 

I do not know if you worked it out with=
 her before hand, but if not, then remember: It is in good form to check it=
 out with the owner/creator of any base before you sneak in - you never kno=
w what traps they have in place. if you can't work it out in advance then y=
ou can do it slowly, step by step to get thier responses before moving in. =
:)

Not trying to be critical or anything just informative and fair, and I =
am sure Airly doesnt mind. I still look forward to the RP :)

Preston

>

>ooc: You got it.  Cyclonus better be ready, Tucson isn't one to=
 give up too quickly. 
>
>>BIC:
>
>>The drive to succeed, it was now surgin=
g rapidly through Tucson's pistons and fuel injectors. He wasn't about to l=
et a little pot hole get in the way of him reaching his leader who he now b=
elieved was POW and held under demonic control. Reaching speeds of well ove=
r one twenty MPH he kicks up dust beneath his tires and handles the roughne=
ss of the terrain as if it were as smooth as newly laid down asphault.  His=
 sonar systems now pick up the density and size of the dark tower which dri=
ves him forward, not to mention the fact that he could pick up heat signatu=
res which resembled his own.  He knew.  Rodimus was there, and no doubt he'=
d be there with some familliar enemies.  The thought of Decepticons being i=
nvolved in this enrages him even more.
>
>>He thinks things through while d=
riving toward the tower, where he could sense Rodimus's heat signatures.
>
=
>>" How could I have let this happen?  If I hadn't let my guard down the fi=
rst time, and gotten myself shot, you wouldn't be in this mess Rodimus.  I =
promise you this though, this time, I will bring you back, and I will not a=
bandon you.  No matter how hateful you are of me, no matter how badly you w=
ant to destroy me.  My spark is dedicated to those I care deeply for.  That=
 part of me will never die.  I will also make those who are responsible for=
 what they have done to you, pay for what they did.  They had no right taki=
ng your spark and your soul.  I swear by the name of Primus that I will ris=
k my own spark to see yours safely out of harm's way."
>
>>He was now neari=
ng the tower.  Another familliar signature pings loudly in his sonar system=
.  He could tell by the frequency that it was from a Decepticon.  He could =
also identify the carrier.
>
>>"Cyclonus...  Ohh yeah, this definitely has =
your name writen all over it.  Right, well, enjoy the party while it lasts =
because I'm about to crash it... Literally."
>
>>He senses he's only a few =
feet from the tower, and transforms.  Yet, he keeps hidden.  He knew that a=
n all out attack wasn't the best way to go.  If he was going to succeed in =
this mission, he'd have to do it without being seen and right underneath Cy=
clonus's nose.  He was good at staying out of the sight of the enemy.  Not =
only had he trained with Kup, but also trained with Prowl.  Silence was his=
 middle name.  He sends a low powered sonar wave to see if it picks up anyt=
hing.  In the general area he was clear of incombants.  He knew that if he =
touched the tower there could be an alarm system.  He scans for that.
>
>>"=
Hmm... Just in case, I should activate a scrambling wave.  That should quie=
t any security system that could be active here..  I hope."
>
>>He waits a =
good five minuts or so until he's sure that the system is disabled.  Once h=
e runs a scan of his sonar systems, he concludes that it did indeed have a =
mild effect on the system, which made it safe for him to approach the tower=
.  He again hides behind a mass of debris, and finds that breeze catches hi=
s face, from the opposite side of the tower. There was a door that was part=
ially opened.  He feels for it with his fingers, and quietly slides it open=
 just enough to sqeeze in, which was a little bit of a squeeze for him.  Th=
is was it, he was inside.  Again, not wanting to make it obvious, he quietl=
y slides the door just a bit ajar, to make sure he isn't discovered.  Then,=
 quietly he hides again, and stops to try to pick up Rodimus's heat signatu=
re once more.  It was difficult, because his temperature continued to drop =
with every ounce of energy that was being stolen from him. 
>
>>" All right=
, low heat signature, this is going to make it a little difficult to track.=
  Time to boost up my receptors a bit... And it wouldn't hurt to scramble m=
y signals either..." 
>
>>Tucson had never known fear and apprehension.  Wi=
th every slow step, he becomes more and more familliar with both emotions. =
 He couldn't let them stop him.  He was doing this to save Rodimus, a gestu=
re from the spark who's power is relentless.  His affections for his leader=
 keeps him focused on the task at hand.  And it isn't long until his persis=
tance pays off.  The ping was loud and clear, and yes, it was Rodimus.  The=
 signature read Decepticon though.  But knowing what Kenzo had told him, he=
 keeps reserved.  Now, he wanted to be seen and heard.  With his cross bow =
subspaced he stands idol, but ready for anything.  And quietly with a soft =
tone of voice..
>
>>"Rodimus."
>
>>--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, Super Cy=
clonus <supercyclonus@ ...> wrote:
>>>
>>> Just to clarify. The physical st=
ructure that holds the energy of the matrix is still inside of Rodimus, but=
 the energy itself was siphoned out by Cyclonus during one of their climati=
c encounters. It was part of what has given Cyclonus his new found power.
>=
>> 
>>> Sandy feel free to go ahead. I think this will all make for good RP=
. I look forward to it. 
>>> 
>>> Preston
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> >
>>> >Fr=
om: Sandy <magicquartz@ ...>
>>> >To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com
>>> >Sent: Fr=
i, February 12, 2010 11:56:34 PM
>>> >Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus
>>> >=

>>> >  >
>>> >> 
>>> > 
>>> >OOC: Okay.  Still works though, because Tucso=
n doesn't know that it's left his body just yet.  Last he knew he still had=
 it.. Good thing he didn't remember anything after his first major injury. =
 It works out.  He'll find out when he finds him I guess.
>>> >
>>> >>--- I=
n nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, <airly2002@ ..> wrote:
>>> >>>
>>> >>> OOC: the =
matrix isnt inside Rodimus is insinde of one minion I dont remember who
>>>=
 >>> 
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> From: Sandy 
>>> >>> Sent: Friday, February 12, 2010=
 10:33 PM
>>> >>> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com 
>>> >>> Subject: Recovering =
Rodimus
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> From what Kenzo had told him, Tu=
cson could now put two and two together and now realized that his restorati=
on abilities along with his skills as a warrior, would be needed more than =
ever. To him Restoration was more than just restoring artifacts, making the=
m appear and work like new, it was also about restoring old programming and=
 recovery of important data. He did not know the extent of the corruption u=
pon which was placed on Rodimus but he knew he couldn't just throw in the t=
owel on his leader. Autobots stuck together, and through thick and thin, he=
'd keep his pledge to never abandon his fellow Autobots. He also realized t=
hat if he was going to get anywhere, he'd have to do it himself. 
>>> >>> 
=
>>> >>> "On second thought, I think I'll go this one alone. Don't wait up f=
or me, I don't think I'll be back too soon."
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> He bids Kenzo=
 good bye and walks out of the room. 
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> "Oh before I forget,=
 have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. He'll need it more than me." 
>>=
> >>> 
>>> >>> He was dead set on recovering his leader. And this time, not=
hing and no one would get in his way of achieving his mission. He sends one=
 final message to Lord Perseus.
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> "Lord Perseus, it's come t=
o my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has been abducted and altered=
 severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a grave Risk, but most of =
all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to waste for evil purposes.=
 I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corruptive state. I hereby an=
nounce that I am on route to locating my leader, and I DO intend to BRING H=
IM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If not, there is question o=
f the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, perhaps not for my own p=
ersonal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It's too precious to los=
e to the hands of those who thirst for power and greed. I swear by Primus's=
 name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast one. May Primus guide=
 you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I will report to you aga=
in, once I know more of the condition of my leader."
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> He si=
gns off, gets off the ship, and transforms into SUV mode, hoping to find Ro=
dimus via his sonar systems.
>>> >>> 
>>> >>> Tag: Kraftlos and Cyclonus.

      <p>ooc: You got it.  Cyclonus better be ready, T=
ucson isn't one to give up too quickly.  <br>
<br>
BIC:<br>
<br>
The drive =
to succeed, it was now surging rapidly through Tucson's pistons and fuel in=
jectors. He wasn't about to let a little pot hole get in the way of him rea=
ching his leader who he now believed was POW and held under demonic control=
. Reaching speeds of well over one twenty MPH he kicks up dust beneath his =
tires and handles the roughness of the terrain as if it were as smooth as n=
ewly laid down asphault.  His sonar systems now pick up the density and siz=
e of the dark tower which drives him forward, not to mention the fact that =
he could pick up heat signatures which resembled his own.  He knew.  Rodimu=
s was there, and no doubt he'd be there with some familliar enemies.  The t=
hought of Decepticons being involved in this enrages him even more.<br>
<br=
>
He thinks things through while driving toward the tower, where he could s=
ense Rodimus's heat signatures.<br>
<br>
" How could I have let this happen=
?  If I hadn't let my guard down the first time, and gotten myself shot, yo=
u wouldn't be in this mess Rodimus.  I promise you this though, this time, =
I will bring you back, and I will not abandon you.  No matter how hateful y=
ou are of me, no matter how badly you want to destroy me.  My spark is dedi=
cated to those I care deeply for.  That part of me will never die.  I will =
also make those who are responsible for what they have done to you, pay for=
 what they did.  They had no right taking your spark and your soul.  I swea=
r by the name of Primus that I will risk my own spark to see yours safely o=
ut of harm's way."<br>
<br>
He was now nearing the tower.  Another famillia=
r signature pings loudly in his sonar system.  He could tell by the frequen=
cy that it was from a Decepticon.  He could also identify the carrier.<br>
=
<br>
"Cyclonus...  Ohh yeah, this definitely has your name writen all over =
it.  Right, well, enjoy the party while it lasts because I'm about to crash=
 it... Literally."<br>
<br>
He senses he's only a few feet from the tower, =
and transforms.  Yet, he keeps hidden.  He knew that an all out attack wasn=
't the best way to go.  If he was going to succeed in this mission, he'd ha=
ve to do it without being seen and right underneath Cyclonus's nose.  He wa=
s good at staying out of the sight of the enemy.  Not only had he trained w=
ith Kup, but also trained with Prowl.  Silence was his middle name.  He sen=
ds a low powered sonar wave to see if it picks up anything.  In the general=
 area he was clear of incombants.  He knew that if he touched the tower the=
re could be an alarm system.  He scans for that.<br>
<br>
"Hmm... Just in c=
ase, I should activate a scrambling wave.  That should quiet any security s=
ystem that could be active here..  I hope."<br>
<br>
He waits a good five m=
inuts or so until he's sure that the system is disabled.  Once he runs a sc=
an of his sonar systems, he concludes that it did indeed have a mild effect=
 on the system, which made it safe for him to approach the tower.  He again=
 hides behind a mass of debris, and finds that breeze catches his face, fro=
m the opposite side of the tower. There was a door that was partially opene=
d.  He feels for it with his fingers, and quietly slides it open just enoug=
h to sqeeze in, which was a little bit of a squeeze for him.  This was it, =
he was inside.  Again, not wanting to make it obvious, he quietly slides th=
e door just a bit ajar, to make sure he isn't discovered.  Then, quietly he=
 hides again, and stops to try to pick up Rodimus's heat signature once mor=
e.  It was difficult, because his temperature continued to drop with every =
ounce of energy that was being stolen from him.  <br>
<br>
" All right, low=
 heat signature, this is going to make it a little difficult to track.  Tim=
e to boost up my receptors a bit... And it wouldn't hurt to scramble my sig=
nals either..."  <br>
<br>
Tucson had never known fear and apprehension.  W=
ith every slow step, he becomes more and more familliar with both emotions.=
  He couldn't let them stop him.  He was doing this to save Rodimus, a gest=
ure from the spark who's power is relentless.  His affections for his leade=
r keeps him focused on the task at hand.  And it isn't long until his persi=
stance pays off.  The ping was loud and clear, and yes, it was Rodimus.  Th=
e signature read Decepticon though.  But knowing what Kenzo had told him, h=
e keeps reserved.  Now, he wanted to be seen and heard.  With his cross bow=
 subspaced he stands idol, but ready for anything.  And quietly with a soft=
 tone of voice..<br>
<br>
"Rodimus."<br>
<br>

s restoration abilities along with his skills as a warrior, would be needed=
 more than ever. To him Restoration was more than just restoring artifacts,=
 making them appear and work like new, it was also about restoring old prog=
ramming and recovery of important data. He did not know the extent of the c=
orruption upon which was placed on Rodimus but he knew he couldn't just thr=
ow in the towel on his leader. Autobots stuck together, and through thick a=
nd thin, he'd keep his pledge to never abandon his fellow Autobots. He also=
 realized that if he was going to get anywhere, he'd have to do it himself.=
 <br>
> >>> <br>
> >>> "On second thought, I think =
I'll go this one alone. Don't wait up for me, I don't think I'll be back to=
o soon."<br>
> >>> <br>

> >>> <br>
> >>> =
"Oh before I forget, have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. He'll need i=

> >>> <br>
> >>> He was dead =
set on recovering his leader. And this time, nothing and no one would get i=
n his way of achieving his mission. He sends one final message to Lord Pers=
eus.<br>
> >>> <br>
> >>> "Lord Perseus, it's come =
to my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has been abducted and altere=
d severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a grave Risk, but most of=
 all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to waste for evil purposes=
. I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corruptive state. I hereby a=
nnounce that I am on route to locating my leader, and I DO intend to BRING =
HIM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If not, there is question =
of the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, perhaps not for my own =
personal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It's too precious to lo=
se to the hands of those who thirst for power and greed. I swear by Primus'=
s name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast one. May Primus guid=
e you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I will report to you ag=
ain, once I know more of the condition of my leader."<br>
> >>>=
